oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Measuring the Aharonov-Anandan phase in photonics
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wang, Kai
Weimann, Steffen
Perez-Leija, Armando
Szameit, Alexander
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Physics - Optics
Quantum Physics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Aharonov-Anandan phase is a description of the geometric nature in non-adiabatic cyclic evolutions of quantum states. Here we report on a measurement of the Aharonov-Anandan phase in photonics. We consider a time-independent quantum driven harmonic oscillator that is initially prepared at the vacuum state. We utilize evanescently coupled waveguides to realize this physical model and achieve a measurement of the Aharonov-Anandan phase via integrated interferometry.
